meanings.definition: To give less change than is due.
meanings.sent1: The cashier shortchanged me by mistake.
meanings.sent2: I hope the vending machine doesn't shortchange me again.
meanings.sent3: I felt shortchanged when my piggy bank only had a few coins.
meanings.sent4: Her apology shortchanged the sincerity of her words.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick left the audience feeling shortchanged.

meanings.definition: To treat someone unfairly by not giving them what they deserve.
meanings.sent1: It's not right to shortchange others just to benefit yourself.
meanings.sent2: The boss shortchanged his employees by not paying overtime.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt shortchanged when it received a smaller portion of treats.
meanings.sent4: His actions shortchanged the trust his friends had in him.
meanings.sent5: The referee's bad call shortchanged the winning team.

meanings.definition: To receive less than what is expected or deserved.
meanings.sent1: I always feel shortchanged when my order is missing an item.
meanings.sent2: She felt shortchanged after watching the movie with the abrupt ending.
meanings.sent3: The student felt shortchanged when the teacher skipped an important lesson.
meanings.sent4: The delay in delivery shortchanged the customer's satisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The athlete felt shortchanged by the unfair judgment of the referee.
